question_stem.en: A 35-year-old, right-handed mechanic comes to the clinic due to progressive right hand weakness. The patient frequently uses a screwdriver at work. Neurologic examination shows preserved sensation in the upper limbs. There is weakness on extension of the fingers and thumb in the right hand. Strength is otherwise intact. Triceps reflexes are 2+ and bilaterally symmetric. The nerve affected in this patient was most likely injured at which of the following locations?
question_stem.zh: 一位35岁的右利手机械工因进行性右手无力前来就诊。患者在工作中经常使用螺丝刀。神经系统检查显示上肢感觉保留。右手手指和拇指伸展无力。其他方面力量完整。肱三头肌反射为2+，双侧对称。该患者受累的神经最有可能在以下哪个位置受伤？

question.en: The nerve affected in this patient was most likely injured at which of the following locations?
question.zh: 该患者受累的神经最有可能在以下哪个位置受伤？

summary.en:
This question tests the understanding of radial nerve anatomy and the clinical presentation of injuries at different locations along its course. It requires correlating specific motor deficits (weakness in finger and thumb extension) with the anatomical innervation of the radial nerve and its branches.

To solve this question, one must first identify the nerve responsible for the observed motor deficits. Then, consider the anatomical pathways of that nerve and the typical clinical syndromes associated with injury at various points. The pattern of weakness and preserved sensation is key to localizing the injury.
summary.zh:
这道题考察了对桡神经解剖结构的理解，以及其沿程不同位置损伤的临床表现。它需要将特定的运动功能障碍（手指和拇指伸展无力）与桡神经及其分支的解剖支配联系起来。

要解决这个问题，首先必须确定引起观察到的运动功能障碍的神经。然后，考虑该神经的解剖通路，以及与在各个点损伤相关的典型临床综合征。无力和感觉保留的模式是定位损伤的关键。

tags: Radial nerve; Posterior interosseous nerve; Supinator syndrome; Finger drop; Nerve injury; Musculoskeletal; Neurology; Anatomy
